item.title: 🥸 Who?
item.description:
Hi 👋🏻 I am Nicolas Manini, a Computer Science PhD Student at the IMDEA Software Institute and Universidad Politécnica de Madrid. I am part of Pierre Ganty’s group.
🧑🏻‍💻 In my research I focus on topics such as Automata Theory, Formal Verification and Abstract Interpretation.

🔙 Background

  • 🎓 Master’s Degree in Computer Science at the University of Pisa (2021),
    Thesis: “Deciding Program Properties via Complete Abstractions on Bounded Domains”, supervised by R. Bruni and R. Gori.
  • 🎓 Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science at the University of Pisa (2018),
    Thesis: “Approximate logic synthesis of Boolean functions”, supervised by A. Bernasconi.

👨🏻‍🏫 Experience

  • Student Counselor for the “Programming and Algorithms” course, (University of Pisa, Oct 2020 - Feb 2021). Held supplementary meetings lectures on topics related to theoretical aspects of algorithms, complexity and data structures.

item.title: 🧑🏻‍💻 My Work
item.description:
📝 Papers:

  • Computing Reachable Simulations on Transition Systems
    P. Ganty, N. Manini, F. Ranzato. RP 2024. [PDF] [arXiv]
  • Deciding Program Properties via Complete Abstractions on Bounded Domains
    R. Bruni, R. Gori, N. Manini. SAS 2022. [PDF]

🖼️ Posters:

  • Complete Abstraction on Bounded Domains
    My I[M]DEA Show Your Work Day 2023. [PDF]
  • Online Simulation Reduction
    My I[M]DEA Show Your Work Day 2022. [PDF]
